info.title: Service Usages
info.description: This API product facilitates insights into internet consumption preferences and usage across venue WiFi sites. These APIs provide aggregated/anonymized information to ensure compliance with data privacy policies. It provides interfaces to query internet service usage and consumption preferences across content categories and sites.

get.description: Lists total service usage across categories for the specified country or site. The response can be filtered by specifying one or more optional query parameters. To limit the number of service-usage details in the response, specify the `page_size` query parameter.

schema.title: Service Usages
schema.description: A collection of service-usage details with links that facilitates pagination.

items.description: The collection of service-usage details.

items.title: Service Usage
items.description: The service-usage details.

service.title: Service
service.description: A specific web service or online destination.

name.description: The name of the web service.

description.description: A description of the web service.

category.title: Service Category
category.description: An hierarchical classification for a web service or online destination.

id.description: The identifier for the service category.

name.description: The name of the service catregory.

description.description: A description of the service category.

parent.description: The optional parent for this classification.

url.description: The root location of the service.

start_date.description: A date and time representation, a profile of ISO 8601 date/time standard, defined by [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

end_date.description: A date and time representation, a profile of ISO 8601 date/time standard, defined by [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

country.description:
The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as is used in that country's top-level domain names.
. Note that PayPal adds the proprietary code C2 for Chinese international transactions.

data_volume.description: Absolute volume of data used in GB.

percentge.description: Percentages as fixed-point, signed decimal values. Represent a rate of 19.99% as 19.99. Valid number formats are plain decimal numbers and whole numbers. Unlike a JSON number or JSON schema number type, this value MUST NOT be deserialized in JavaScript into a JavaScript Number object, which is 64-bit floating-point and cannot accurately represent all values transmitted by this type. Likewise, in Java, this type MUST be deserialized into a BigDecimal or other fixed-point numeric type.

items.title: Link Description Object
items.description: The HATEOAS links related to the request.

href.description: The complete target URL, or link, to use in combination with the method to make the related call, as defined by [RFC 6570](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570), with the addition of the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters for pre-processing. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. For possible values, see [Link Relationship Types](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt), that describes the link target.

method.description: The HTTP method required for the related call.

submissionEncType.description: The media type in which to submit data in the request.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

name.description: A unique name for the error.

source_id.description: A correlation dentifier to tie to the underlying errror that may help with debugging.

information_link.description: An URI that provides more information about this error.

items.title: Error Details
items.description: The details for an error; these describe client-side `4xx` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. For fields in the body, set this value to the JSON pointer to the field.

value.description: The value of field causing the error.

location.description: The location of field causing the error; valid values are `body`, `path`, or `query` - the default is `body`.

issue.description: The underlying reason for the error.

links.description: HATEOAS links specific to the error context.

items.description: The HATEOAS links related to the request.

href.description: The complete target URL, or link, to use in combination with the method to make the related call, as defined by [RFC 6570](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570), with the addition of the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters for pre-processing. submissionEncType.description: The media type in which to submit data in the request.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Filters the service usage by country code.

parameters.name: site_id
parameters.description: Filters the service usage by site.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the usage period.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the usage period.

parameters.name: service_category_id
parameters.description: Filters service usage for the specified category.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Limits number of service usage details in the response to this page-size.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to fetch results for the next page. It is returned in the response to the previous call. The next-page link in the response is `null` if there are no more results in the next page.

parameters.name: total_required
parameters.description: Indicates whether the total number of items is expected in the response.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sorts the usage details in the response by usage or category.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sorts the usage details in the response in ascending or descending order.

get.description: Lists total voucher usage for the specified country or site. The response can be filtered by specifying one or more optional query parameters. To limit the number of voucher-usage details in the response, specify the `page_size` query parameter.

schema.title: Voucher Usages
schema.description: A collection of voucher-usage details with links that facilitates pagination.

items.description: The collection of voucher-usage details.

items.title: Voucher Usage
items.description: Voucher usage or session details for a site.

start_date.description: A date and time representation, a profile of ISO 8601 date/time standard, defined by [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

end_date.description: A date and time representation, a profile of ISO 8601 date/time standard, defined by [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

site.title: Site details
site.description: The details for a Wi-Fi access site.

description.description: Other optional description for the site.

country.description:
The [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as is used in that country's top-level domain names.
. Note that PayPal adds the proprietary code C2 for Chinese international transactions.

geo-location.title: Geographic coordinates
geo-location.description: JSON schema for geocode in latitude and longitude.

address.description: The postal address for the site.

usage_details.description: The details on voucher or session usage.

total_time.description: Total time, in minutes, used across voucher sessions.

average_time.description: Average time, in minutes, used per voucher session.

total_data.description: Total volume of data used, in GB.

average_data.description: Average volume of data used per voucher data, in MB.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Filters the voucher usage by country code.

parameters.name: site_id
parameters.description: Filters the voucher usage by site.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the usage period.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the usage period.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Limits number of voucher usage details in the response to this page-size.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to fetch results for the next page. It is returned in the response to the previous call. The next-page link in the response is `null` if there are no more results in the next page.

parameters.name: total_required
parameters.description: Indicates whether the total number of items is expected in the response.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sorts the usage details in the response by data usage, time usage, or number of vouchers.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sorts the usage details in the response in ascending or descending order.

category.title: Service Category
category.description: An hierarchical classification for a web service or online destination.

id.description: The identifier for the service category.

name.description: The name of the service catregory.

description.description: A description of the service category.

parent.description: The optional parent for this classification.

url.description: The root location of the service.

name.description: A unique name for the error.

source_id.description: A correlation dentifier to tie to the underlying errror that may help with debugging.

information_link.description: An URI that provides more information about this error.

items.title: Error Details
items.description: The details for an error; these describe client-side `4xx` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. For fields in the body, set this value to the JSON pointer to the field.

value.description: The value of field causing the error.

location.description: The location of field causing the error; valid values are `body`, `path`, or `query` - the default is `body`.

issue.description: The underlying reason for the error.

links.description: HATEOAS links specific to the error context.

items.title: Link Description Object
items.description: The HATEOAS links related to the request.

href.description: The complete target URL, or link, to use in combination with the method to make the related call, as defined by [RFC 6570](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570), with the addition of the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters for pre-processing. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. For possible values, see [Link Relationship Types](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt), that describes the link target.

method.description: The HTTP method required for the related call.

submissionEncType.description: The media type in which to submit data in the request.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the web service.

scopes.https://api.viasat.com/v1/insights/servi: Allows to read service usage details
